message.entry: Switching to software OpenGL rendering is not supported on the Mac platform.
Switching to software OpenGL rendering at runtime on unix is not supported.
Switching to hardware OpenGL rendering is not supported on the Mac platform.
Switching to hardware OpenGL rendering at runtime on unix is not supported.
Software OpenGL rendering is not supported on the Mac platform.
OpenGL failed to load.
An error occurred while querying for OpenGL:
An error occurred while querying for OpenGL:
Unknown OpenGL bug workaround: {0}
known graphics driver issues
OpenGL incorrect input argument: {0}
The opengl function does not accept the option 'software'. Start MATLAB with the '-softwareopengl' option to run with software OpenGL.
The opengl function does not accept the option 'hardware'. The default rendering mode for MATLAB Graphics is hardware opengl.
This option does not have any effect since it is no longer supported: {0}
The opengl command without any arguments is no longer supported.
File {0} not found

MATLAB previously crashed due to a low-level graphics error. To prevent another crash in this session, MATLAB is using software OpenGL instead of using your graphics hardware. To save this setting for future sessions, use the opengl('save', 'software') command. For more information, see Resolving Low-Level Graphics Issues.
MATLAB previously crashed due to a low-level graphics error while using software OpenGL. For more information, see Resolving Low-Level Graphics Issues.
Unable to select hardware OpenGL rendering. For more information, click here.
Changing the OpenGL implementation at the command line is not supported. Instead, specify the implementation when starting MATLAB.
OpenGL Startup options will be removed in a future release.
Setting the renderer will not be supported in a future release.
Specifying the renderer preference will not be supported in a future release.
The opengl function will be removed in a future release. Use the rendererinfo function instead.
The GraphicsSmoothing property will be removed in a future release. All graphics will be smooth regardless of the property value.
The FontSmoothing property will be removed in a future release. All text will be smooth regardless of the property value.
